description:
Internship allround marketing (Display)

Evert van de Beekstraat 310, Amsterdam, Netherlands

Position Summary

Introduction
Are you ready to start your career in Marketing at one of the biggest electronics companies in the world? Are you curious to get a taste of the Professional Displays world and understand what makes our partners and end-users tick? As a member of our multi-channel marketing team, we are looking for someone who understands that Content is King and who can manage the various digital and traditional options to spread our Samsung Display philosophy.
With your recent (or almost completed) HBO/Bachelor degree, you will join one of the biggest electronics companies in the world. We’re counting on young talents like you so that we can create the future together. As an ambitious graduate, you’ll get the chance to dive into our way of working and contribute to our Display projects in the Benelux.
Are you the CAN-DO Marketing Intern we are looking for? Kickstart your career today!

Role and Responsibilities

What Will You Do?
Your journey at Samsung Professional Display will be a daily learning curve where you experience different communication flows from Suwon HQ, the European Office, and your local colleagues. Although every day brings something new, there are recurring needs where you can really make a difference.

Your main tasks will include:

Creative Assets – We receive daily materials from Suwon HQ and the European Office. Ensuring these land with the right people can be challenging. You’ll become the go-to person for organizing and managing systems like Partner Portal (for B2B partners), Samsung Marketing Cloud (for B2C retailers), Jira, and Channext.
Samsung.com (S.com) – Managing the Professional Display pages on Samsung.com is more than a handful. Automated systems sometimes cause outdated products, translation flaws, broken links, or download errors. Updating and correcting these pages requires stakeholder meetings (Benelux level), filtering Suwon updates, and gathering input from product managers.
Creative Go-to Person for Partners – Distributors and channel partners regularly promote Samsung’s Professional Display products. You’ll review and sign off partner designs (newsletters, banners, events) to ensure they follow Samsung Brand Principles and the latest updates.
(E)Retail Support – Besides B2B products, we sell a large number of gaming and smart monitors via major (E)tailers. You’ll support both standard digital marketing activities and innovative tools to optimize spend. You’ll also assist with in-store and online branding with these partners.
Event Support – Locally, the Dutch and Belgian display teams host several events throughout the year, targeting either business end-users or key channel stakeholders. You’ll support agency management, sample management, keynote speaker preparation, and overall event organization.
Administrative Tasks – Every job requires proper logging: IT tickets, agency briefings, budget requests through corporate systems, etc. This might not be the most exciting part, but it’s essential. You’ll gain firsthand experience with Samsung’s marketing and finance procedures and understand their role in strategic planning.

Skills and Qualifications

What Are Your Assets
As a Marketing Intern, you bring:

Knowledge & Experience: You are currently pursuing an HBO (or Master) degree in Economics, Communication, or Marketing. Students from other field with relevant experience and the right mindset are also welcome!
Spontaneous Personality: You have strong communication skills and know how to convince others with your dedication and enthusiasm.
Sociable & Proactive Mindset: You enjoy working with colleagues and external stakeholders while building a strong network.
Critical & Analytical Thinking: You can identify new opportunities and solve challenges effectively.
Personal Leadership: You are actively focused on your personal development. You know how your talents, pitfalls, and challenges, and you are eager to grow both professionally and personally.
Language Skills: You speak Dutch and English fluently (French is a plus but not mandatory).
Dynamic Attitude: You thrive in a fast-paced, international environment that is constantly evolving.

We also request:

You are in the final year of your HBO and looking for a graduation internship.
You have an interest in marketing, communications and economics.
You are proactive, creative, and have a hands-on mentality.
You are available for 32 to 40 hours per week, with at least 4 days at our office at Schiphol.

What Do We Offer You?

An internship allowance of €600 per month.
The possibility to use the company restaurant, where you can enjoy an extensive lunch for a competitive price and even freshly prepared evening meals by our Samsung chef to take home every day.
A phone and laptop on loan
We have our own fitness on-site which you can use

About Samsung
At Samsung, we believe in making the impossible possible. For over 50 years, we’ve been innovating to help people achieve their dreams. Our mission? To develop technology that has a positive impact on the world and daily life. Join us and help strengthen Samsung’s position as an employer!

Ready for the Challenge?
Do you want to make a valuable contribution to our team while developing yourself? Apply now and start your career at Samsung!
